article_title: It’s Happy Hour, and Uncle Sam Is Pouring
article_text:
Boise, Idaho

Like someone who has spent too long in a tavern and can’t recall how many beers he downed, many state leaders seem oblivious to how thoroughly their budgets have become soaked with federal dollars. Convinced that the federal largess will continue always and forever, they aren’t terribly worried about a reversal of fortunes. They should be.

Dependence on federal money leaves millions of Americans at risk of losing...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Wayne Hoffman writes that state budgets are dangerously dependent on Washington. Look out if the cash flow stops.
twitter.title: It’s Happy Hour, and Uncle Sam Is Pouring
